intro: Cynanchum rusillonii, commonly known as the Russian milkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae, which includes many milkweed species known for their milky sap. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its roots are fibrous and can produce a latex that is toxic to some animals. Cynanchum rusillonii is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates.
